description: The banknote authentication dataset contains features extracted from images of genuine and forged banknote specimens using Wavelet Transform tool. Data were collected from 400x400 pixel grayscale images at 660 dpi resolution taken with an industrial camera for print inspection. The dataset is used to distinguish between authentic and counterfeit banknotes.
creator: Volker Lohweg (University of Applied Sciences, Ostwestfalen-Lippe)

feature_descriptions.V1: Statistical measure of dispersion in pixel intensities after wavelet transformation
feature_descriptions.V2: Measure of asymmetry in the distribution of pixel intensities after wavelet transformation
feature_descriptions.V3: Measure of the tailedness of the probability distribution of pixel intensities after wavelet transformation
feature_descriptions.V4: Measure of randomness or information content in the image

use_case: Authentication of banknotes to detect counterfeits using image processing features
ethical_considerations: The dataset should be used responsibly to improve banknote security features and counterfeit detection systems. Misuse for creating counterfeits is illegal and unethical.
